questions.question: Define the term oxidation.
questions.answer: Loss of electrons or increase in oxidation number.

questions.question: Define the term reduction.
questions.answer: Gain of electrons or decrease in oxidation number.

questions.question: State what is meant by a reducing agent.
questions.answer: A substance that donates electrons and is itself oxidised.

questions.question: Explain why chlorine is a stronger oxidising agent than bromine.
questions.answer: Chlorine has a higher tendency to gain electrons because it has a smaller atomic radius and stronger attraction between nucleus and incoming electrons.

questions.question: State the trend in reactivity of Group 2 metals as you go down the group.
Explain why Group 2 metals become more reactive down the group.
questions.answer: Ionisation energy decreases due to increased shielding and atomic radius, so electrons are lost more easily.
